meanings.definition: To work in or care for a garden.
meanings.sent1: She gardened diligently, planting new flowers every week.
meanings.sent2: Yesterday, I gardened in my backyard and trimmed the bushes.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels decided to help by gardened in the wrong flower bed.
meanings.sent4: Her love for gardening gardened her soul, nurturing it with each bloom.
meanings.sent5: The elderly man gardened with such passion that his garden became a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To cultivate or tend a garden.
meanings.sent1: They gardened the community garden together, growing vegetables for everyone.
meanings.sent2: Last summer, we gardened a beautiful rose garden in the front yard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat gardened by digging up all the freshly planted seeds.
meanings.sent4: She gardened her dreams, nurturing them with care and patience.
meanings.sent5: The gardened soil yielded a bountiful harvest, rewarding their hard work.

meanings.sent1: Their gardened backyard was a peaceful retreat from the city noise.
meanings.sent2: The gardened estate boasted colorful flowers and lush greenery.
meanings.sent3: The gardened park was a favorite spot for picnics and relaxation.
meanings.sent4: She lived in a gardened community where every house had its own unique garden.
meanings.sent5: The gardened landscape was a sight to behold, with flowers of every hue.
